list_definition.definition: (of people) behaving, talking etc in a mild, kindly, pleasant way

list_ex_of_english: He was initially well-liked, as his rule was seen as gentler and less formidable than his father.
His favorite approach has been to explore the innocuous-seeming use of another person to fill one's gentler emotional needs.
Flexibility allows the wing to be less susceptible to turbulence and provides a gentler flying experience than a similarly-sized rigid-winged aircraft.
The gentler turn allows easier and quicker parking, narrower aisles, and thus higher density than perpendicular parking.
With a gentle push on the back, the human body reacts with the ankle strategy.
He is a warm and gentle man, but-as you know-his intellect is like lightning.
We displaced the ants from the nectaries by gentle shaking and delicately rubbed earthworms on each nectary to apply mucus.
A bar under the tub signifies a gentler treatment in the machine.
